author: {'steamid': '76561197986780380', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1450595140}
review: Highly underrated game about cleaning up areas as fast as you can while keeping combos and speed going. Easy to play, hard to master. High skill ceiling. The leaderboards are kind of fucked the last time I check with people beating maps in less than a second, but I never really cared much about leaderboards anyway. There is a ton of content in this game and several playstyles to use. Watch some videos on Youtube, the execution required to pull off perfect runs is on par with DMC and fighting games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005600121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1360224000}
review: Dustforce is one of those rare gems that comes along and really funks your day up. The style and goal of the game are as simple as white but when the terrain gets rough it gets reaaaal rough. It will take some time to get a feel for your characters capiblities then some more time to apply them in jump chain after jump. Best part about this game though is the soundtrack.... LOVE THAT SHIT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014946638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1361260800}
review: This is my dream job and something I look forward to becoming after attending college, a sanitary engineering. This game teaches the basics of what it means to be a janitor. Sweeping is a lot harder than it seems, and is a lot more skilled and adventurous than you can imagine. Along your typical "sweep" work, you can encounter monsters and other various foes. This game trains you for the real world and offers a very professional and helpful insight for those in the janitorial, or I would say, sanitary engineer career path.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1336201200}
review:
I bought this because the sountrack + game bundle on steam was only $1 more than the soundtrack off the artist's Bandcamp page.  I already liked the music so I'd figure for a dollar more I'd try the game.

Arguably, this is not my game.  I dont find enjoyment in time trials, or in repeat-til-learned drilling gameplay.  I just don't appreciate it.  So that said, it is hard for me to evaluate this game because that's what the game is.  The music is great, I love that.  It helps add a lot to the aesthetic and the game is stylish and captures a feeling of 'coolness' nicely.  I can't comment on the controls because I have no frame of reference.  The game is demanding so naturally I felt flustered and struggled to accomplish the desired action.  As I said, its not my kind of game.

So I guess I'd say pick this up if you like games like Super Meat Boy or N+?  It has a local multiplayer mode somewhat lightly comparable to SSB without items or health meters, but its not online so application for alternative play is limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041030225', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7569, 'last_played': 1575159164}
review: I'm writing a review for this because I'm damn sure it doesn't get enough love. Out of any game on Steam, I'd say this is the most underrated game I've seen. It's got the smoothest, most in depth movement I've seen in a platformer. It's got a wide variety of levels, going from easy as hell to way beyound Super Meat Boy difficulty. It's got a good score system, music, and the art style is just beautiful. The huge variety, low skill floor, and incredibly high skill ceiling make this an absolute masterpiece. This game is in my all time top 10. Great job Hitbox Team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001319766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4278, 'last_played': 1516211224}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984093976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1070, 'last_played': 1446496962}
review:
Looking for an ultra-hard, stylish, hi-score oriented platformer? Oh look here's one right now!
At first I thought it would be like a Super Meat Boy, and in a way it is, but... if you think any of your hard-learned Meat Boy prowess will help you here, you are gravely mistaken and you are going to need to waterproof your gamepad and/or keyboard because there will be a lot of tears.
Meat Boy's approach to wall jumping mechanics was very simple, and the challenges were largely about precision.
Dustforce take a much more strict approach. Rather than simply megaman your way up a wall, you can run up it- for a short distance. Then you'll either need a facing wall, or to spend your precious precious second jump, the one you can't get back without landing on solid ground or killing an enemy in midair. You can also run along slopes and ceilings, air dash, and a number of other fancy tricks that look super cool but all add complexity.
The challenges here are not only about precision, but also working out how long you can save that air jump, which direction to hold (or not hold) when you make contact with the wall, or how to get that extra bit of dust up on the ceiling.
Unfortunately, the experience is hurt a little by slightly picky controls and the rather annoying way momentum is handled when you've wall-run up to the edge of a platform (or anything treated as one, whether it has spikes on it or not).
All in all, I enjoy it, even though the gold-key levels make me furious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993638935', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8934, 'last_played': 1501407026}
review:
This is not a game you can complete by chance or effortless tries. 
You have to understand its core mechanics, the architecture of each level, the tricks you'll need to complete the hardest paths, and after all this understanding, you will need and WANT to master all of it.

The "wonderful" part is that the game doesn't just throw you in a world of spikes and blood. Well, actually it does, but gently. You start from levels which is almost impossible to fail, yet everything in the game reminds you that anything less of a "perfect run" (double S rating) is worthless, that your times are awfully high.

You will then take a look at some videos or replays. 
If you feel ashamed and want to get better at it, well, you're in for a gaming experience like few others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040628952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1490923990}
review:
[h1]Mr. Clean's Got Nothing On This Team[/h1]

Sweep dust up and make it look awesome while doing so. It's a great concept, beautiful and simplistic art, and has bopping tracks you can't resist dancing to. I loved the soundtrack so much, I went out and bought the bundle. It's also one of the better indie-platformers I've played; makes someone like me, who is garbage at platformer, feel good about succeeding.

Just don't risk shift+tabbing out while you're in the middle of a level. I'd do that to reply to someone and sometimes the game would make me redo the entire level from the beginning. That's about the only criticism I have with it. Otherwise, sound, gameplay, and aesthetics are very pleasant. The soundtrack is available from the composer on [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLBB4108C5CB4E1DD6]YouTube here[/url]. Even if you don't pick up this game, at least give these beautiful tracks a listen. My favorites are Cider Time, 9-bit Expedition, and Your Favorite Color.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009587733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1441341489}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993210051', 'num_games_owned': 647, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1418904823}
review: Beautiful art style, laid-back, relaxing chip-tune-esque music, and one of the best side scrolling / combo systems I've ever seen. Great game, just don't push yourself too hard while playing it. You could probably kill your hands trying to top the leaderboards...

author: {'steamid': '76561197979987727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1359273600}
review: An attractive and charming run-and-jump game which reminds me a bit of Super Meat Boy or N, except you can hit stuff with a broom. It seems like my kind of game and I really wanted to like it, but I personally found the play mechanics to be kind of stiff and pretty frustrating. That might be subjective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010897607', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1440145353}
review: Este juego es genial. La musica es maravillosa asi como su colorido y atractivo dise√±o. Hay mucha frustracion envuelta en este juego, no es para jugadores casuales al igual que muchos otros titulos de plataformas de precision (como el Meatboy, N+, They bleed pixels, etc.)  Los controles son difisiles al principio pero el juego te invita a dominarlo y es muy satisfactorio una vez que lo haces. Existe la opcion de configurar los controles al gusto para la comodidad de cualquier jugador. Por sobretodo, un juego muy bien hecho y adictivo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044422242', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1429230765}
review: With tight controls, delightful graphical aesthetics and nothing short of amazing soundtrack, this beautifully designed precision-based platformer is simple yet magnificently deep, and will sure to give hours of fun to those who are willing to challenge its daunting-yet-satisfying levels. This game is the Super Meat boy of 2012, and should be tried by everyone who calls themselves a fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988061219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1559865334}
review: Get a frickin controller, sit down, and prepare for an awesome platoformer. The goal of this game is to remove all the dust and dust monsters, and while that sounds like the most retarded idea in human history, this game is 78 kinds of epic. By using various forms of wall jumping, wall running, ceiling jumping, ceiling running, mid-air jumps, mid-air hit multipiers, and etc., you end up feeling like spider-man on cocaine as you bounce around levels "dusting" things up. I got this as part of the Humble Bundle, and I couldn't be happier it was included. This game is well worth the full price in my humble opinion, and I can't stop myself from trying to get perfect scores on some of these crazy levels!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970072725', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1336546800}

Very much worth every penny, but only if you enjoy trying to play for as close to perfect runs as you can get as that's half the fun of the whole game. But over all a great aesthetic and a very solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012670485', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1641143108}
review: The most enjoyable (but also frustrating) aspect of Dustforce is that it doesn't place survival as the focal point like other 'super-hard' games like Super Meat Boy or I Wanna Be The Guy, but it will demand absolute perfection in order to progress, and you will damn every damn flaw you make. Great controls, beautiful aesthetic stylings, I love it to bits. Needless to say I am so close to hammering my keyboard in tears every time a single mistake ruins a near-perfect run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985666167', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1350, 'last_played': 1627487834}
review: Great precision platformer. Some of the later levels are even harder than Super Meat Boy, but the controls are not as tight (this is the only shortcoming of the game).

review: Probably one of the best platform games i have done in quite a while. The early levels are easy to understand, but if you want to master this game and get perfect runs on every level, then prepare to spend alot of hours in this game. Overall a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 614, 'playtime_forever': 4593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4593, 'last_played': 1542096266}
review:
[b]A perfectionist's platformer.[/b]

It's very much playable on a keyboard, but it might be a bit more recommended to play with a controller, though it seemingly lacks any real support for it outside of being able to bind most of the functions to the controller buttons.

The basic concept of the game is janitors cleaning levels in a very ninja-like manner. There's no story or real goal to the game aside from getting perfect ranks in every level in order to unlock the hardest levels in the game, which is why this game is meant for perfectionists. It's also meant for those who want extreme challenges where‚Äîon a constant basis‚Äîtoo light a tap or too strong a press of the jump button can mean the failure of a run. The controls and mechanics are all great and feel great when you get them to work the way you want, but as you progress you'll need to put in major dedication into mastering them.

The way you access levels in this game is from an overworld of sorts you run around in where you can pretty much get a handle of the basic controls and mechanics of the game. There are tutorial levels at the very beginning and the rest can only be unlocked if you find them.
Many of the entrances to the actual levels themselves are behind skill walls, like extremely complicated jumps that force you to take advantage of the game's seemingly hidden mechanics. They're kind of like tests and learning experiences to teach you and test you about the many things you can do with the game's physics. The easier they are to access, the easier the levels themselves are most likely and vice versa. If you do something with your character that looks like it can be exploited, it's likely a feature.
Once a level is completed, it is immediately unlocked in an easier-to-access level-select area for when you'd like to try the level again and don't want to go all the way to the place you found the door at.
The difficulty in the game is never artificial, at least not on the first attempts. Everything is skill based and the levels can get somewhat lengthy. They start off simple but as you find more levels behind more difficult obstacles, just practicing them can get mind numbing.

Due to how difficult the game eventually gets, you'll be spending hours upon hours doing the same things over & over again just so you can get that perfect rank. There are even leaderboards and replays so you can see how the fastest people got through a level, though they're only unlocked when you actually beat said specific level for the first time. There's no point to just beating anything in this game with ranks that aren't perfect except maybe for the hardest, longest one, which is the most excrutiating to even beat once.
This is a game for those who want nothing but platforming levels that test skill. The idea of janitors cleaning things is just there for novelty purposes. There's no plot or an ending even when you finally beat the last, difficult levels; not even perfecting [i]those[/i] give an ending, so the only real replay value is in the desire to improve. It's all legitimate fun until it starts to become a game about being a hardcore platforming perfectionist for dozens of hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995234530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1630445117}
review:
This game is a fast paced platformer where you try to make everything clean. It's not very hard to get through a level on it's own typically but what you're really after is to get a S rank for both mainting a long combo and getting every piece of trash. As long as your attacking something or cleaning something you can maintain the combo but if you fail and lose it then you probably won't get that S rank. 

There's 4 different areas; a  forest, mansion, city and a labratory. They all have the same rules at play but some have a few different things between them. Initally you only have access to levels that don't have a key required but then you'll have levels that require a bronze, silver or gold key So you have to keep doing well to get to the harder levels. There are some techniques to learn to help you go through levels.

The music is wonderful and varied. I would highly recommend getting the soundtrack.  The calm nature of it helps reduce frustration of failure. It also helps that the graphics are nice to look at and that you can retry a level very quickly. 

I'm not especially good at this game but I really enjoy it. But I think if you're into speed running, getting that perfect score and wanting to retry a level to get that score over again then I think you'll get a lot out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972583539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1664662520}
review: I've played this game for about 5 minutes and am recommending it purely because there aren't enough games that focus on stylishly sweeping shit up off the floor. I think more people would want to be janitors if they could sweep barf and dirt and baby poop off the floor like a ninja, and jobs should be marketed more like that. Then it wouldn't be until after you got employed that you remember that you work for some fuckhead that also hates their job, and still doesn't appreciate anything you do, because they in turn are also not appreciated by the even-bigger fuckhead that they work for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964009814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1349766000}
review:
When I first seen this game, I wanted it and added it to my wishlist.  Just looked like a fun, hop around, kill, and completion game.

However I did not enjoy it nearly to the point I thought I would.  This is actually more like Super Meat Boy with brooms.  Only not as fun, not as funny, and controls not nearly as tight.

Not a bad game, but I felt myself being bugged by the controls and there is no real combat: only appears that way.

The basic idea is that you pick a zone, then pick an area within the zone to clean dust/leaves/goo by jumping and sliding along the walls.  At the end you kill a few monsters who cannot hurt you and the level is over.  You get points to unlock keys to open more areas to do the same thing.

Each of the four janitors plays a little different, but all of them feel a bit awkward or delayed.  More of a muscle memory on some of the levels and not precise contrtols.  Just not as good as what I wanted.

review:

"Dash", "Wallrun" et "Ceilingrun" √† gogo, faites vous tomber sur les pentes pour gagner un max d'√©lan.
En chemin, pensez √† latter les tas de feuilles sauvages, livres poussi√©reux volants, poubelles toxiques et autres bestioles pour avoir droit √† un coup sp√©cial de ninja.
Assez difficile √† prendre en main, on se bousille facilement le pouce sur la manette, pour finalement pas grand chose. La sensation de vitesse est pas toujours l√†, les d√©placements sont tr√®s rigide et le rythme est souvent cass√©.
La difficult√© va de pas tr√®s facile √† Suicidaire.
On appr√©cie de revoir les replay des autres joueurs, un mode multi et un √©diteur de niveaux sont de la partie.
Une bande son qui va plut√¥t bien mais qui devient lassante √† la longue.

Un plateformer bien r√©alis√© graphiquement, mais √† r√©server pour ceux qui n'ont pas de vie sociale et un pouce en b√©ton.

review:
If you ever liked any fast-paced platformer, you'll like this game.
It's well-polished, challenging and has just the right difficulty curve.

It gave me a nostalgia blast because it has this atmosphere of the platformer flash games I used to play back in the day, but then much more well-designed.

This indie game can compete with Amnesia and Braid, and it definitely smashes the competition in its own genre (Super Meat Boy for instance).

review: Being a janitor has never been so much fun, or at least, I've never met a janitor willing to run on the ceiling and walls to clean. author: {'steamid': '76561197977871299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1414715002}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960270242', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3109, 'last_played': 1496191130}
review:
Nice stylized graphics, amazing OST. If you like time trial games, this game is for you. It has an actual legitimate leaderboard (with viewable replays), and I haven't seen any cheating on it.

The game's system is very well conceived, staying simple enough for a novice to have fun, but has enough depth for an advanced player to distance themselves from the rest. There are 4 characters you can use, each one having slightly different attributes.

This game can get really difficult if you're trying for SS rankings, or competing for top times in the leaderboards. If you're not into competing for times or going for 100% completion, then the game becomes considerably less difficult as you can utilize checkpoints in stages and retry from them as many times as you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992550873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1387469950}
review: Very stylish game.  It's a puzzle platformer like N+ or Super Meat Boy, where you are a ninja janitor that cleans walls by running upside down and doing wall jumps.  Pretty awesome music, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033116787', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1356768000}
review: Wundersch√∂nes Spiel mit einem hervorragenden Soundtrack und nicht zu vergessen die Highscore Jagd!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984180394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1514659372}
review:
This is not the monotonous tale of a poor boy bouncing off walls and saving a princess.  This tale goes beyond that.

This is the tale of a person who is on a mission beneficial not just to one person but to the community.  A tale of a person you can relate to.  A hero who touches the janitor in each and every one of us.

More fast paced than Prince of Persia, and rivals the fluid game play of Sonic the Hedgehog, while not quite as fast paced.

review: Dustforce is a softhearted 2D platformer with stylish graphic novel-esque visuals and a sensational soundtrack. When it comes to premise and gameplay experience, this game follows through, making it one of my favorite Indie titles. Much praise to you, Hitbox Team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259299', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1379553474}
review: A unique collision of Super Meat Boy, n, Super Mario Sunshine, and Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, you pick one of four janitor ninjas and dynamically traipse around levels, destroying dust and smacking it off of animated gargoyle statues (as an example). The controls are tight and responsive, but don't expect to get S ranks if you're prone to rage-quitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006574782', 'num_games_owned': 2443, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1478046077}
review: Dustforce is a challenging action arcade platformer in the same vein as Super Meat Boy.  The graphics are serviceable, and the music is exceptionally well done.  I appreciate the fact that the developers attempted to harken back to old style 8-bit audio without actually giving us the terribly awful reality of it (like in Wizorb).  Though the game does work with the Steam Overlay and supports widescreen, the gamepad support is not very well implemented and will require the player to manually reconfigure the control scheme to work.  I found the the native keyboard controls to be cramped and non-intuitive, particularly for a game that requires fast reflexes.  Other users on the forums have reported they prefer the keyboard for later in the game, but I have not progressed far enough to have an opinion one way or another.  Dustforce in short, is a quality indie game that will resonate with fans of Super Meat Boy or VVVVVVvvvvVVVV.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1381622947}
review:
Fantastic game. Awesome concept, and great music. It's difficult to master, but thats the whole point. Once you get the flow going it is sooo rewarding. But don't get angry, take a break often. The game has lots of features to keep expanding and keep you playing.
I can't recommend this game enough! It's the best indie game in ages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025394075', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1340434800}
review: Interesting platformer. The characters all have different little quirks, so if you're having trouble with a level as one, you can switch to another and try again to take advantage of their abilities. Plenty of levels (and a lot of cool fanmade ones as well, which is a huge +), all with varying degress of difficulty, ranging from the, "Woah, that was easy, finished it under a minute!" to "I swear to god, if I fail that jump again I'm going to punch this screen with a shotgun." difficulty. All in all, it's REALLY fun and addictive. I suggest checking it out.

review:
Awesome platformer for those who like a challenge.  Getting to the end of the level? Easy.  Unlocking additional stages? Requires perfection.  I can't recomend this game highly enough for anyone who likes speedruns or similar game competitions.

After 900 hours into this game, I'm still learning new tricks, and still having finished the final two levels.  Grr Yotta.

Edit 3/13/2016: The first mod for dustforce came out a few days ago adding a couple new modes for players to compete in.  Low% is a format we've ben running for awhile but now has leaderboards, and boss mode involves spreading dust and has really strange routing.  It will be awhile before its solved for any level.

review:
THE SUCCESOR TO SUPER MEAT BOY. If you had a great time playing SMB, try this game. 

The cool thing is that you do not need a quick reaction that much, but rather a memorization of the level. The quick reaction comes in on what the next button needs to be pressed. 

Think Fighting games controls embedded in a very complex and fun platformer. 

"WHAT'S THAT SANVICH? PERFECTLY JUMP THEM ALL? GOOD IDEA!" - Heavy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994345983', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 482, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1517014430}
review: A good ten hours of game time presuming you'll give up getting SS ranks on the later levels, hundreds more if you don't. The precision and timing required gets so crazy to a point where I'm happy just watching the leaderboard replays. The level editor is a brilliant feature as it allows you to create really advance maps for all of the game modes.  Although local only there is a multiplayer, either King of the Hill fighting or Survival Smash Bros style. Love the soundtrack by Lifeformed so much that I'm even going to recommend buying that too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051624499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1491901044}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993996349', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1414541644}
review:
If you search for one of the hardest games on the planet, look no further.
This piece of software will crush your fingers, in a positive sense. Remember meatboy? Okay, Dustforce is like Meatboy, just at least 3 times that complex. You don't have just jump and walljump, you have dash, jump, walljump, slide, hit, heavy hit, wallrun, ceilingrun and and...
It is basically extreme parcour in 2d format.
Which is awesome, it plays extremely fluid and you can easily sink into a single level and trying to achieve a better time, this game can become your biggest nemesis and at the same time your best friend.
Besides of the amazing gameplay the graphics are superb for an indie game, and the soundtrack is on it's own is incredible (+editor!).
The only downside that game can have (besides destroying you mentally and physically) would be that it can run quite bad on some pcs.

As long as you don't like platformers or only want pussy-games, I see no reason why you shouldn't grab this game immediately

author: {'steamid': '76561197994920614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5297, 'last_played': 1602709505}
review:
Buy this game, the trailers and screenshots don't even grasp .5% of how awesome it is.
Compared to all the other platformers it's really easy to get started with a really nice learning curve wich isn't even close to steep and at the same time the skill ceiling is non existant.
Leaderboards and ranking system are well made with the possibility to watch every single replay (!) on the board, checkbox for friends only included. Even has a nice multiplayer wich can be played localy with up to 4 people. Not to mention the eargasmic soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961277675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1539550156}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972060127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1387775845}
review:
Another beautiful indie game!  Last year it was Jamestown for me, this year it might well be Dustforce.

This is a great looking, acrobatic/ninja-rific platformer with a chilled out electronic score and a nice scaling difficultly level.  Imagine Meatboy, but way less frustrating and soul-crushingly difficult, plus more move variety, and rewarding combat. (!)

While levels can be beat without necessarily being an ace player, for me there's a strong, strong "I know I can do better" urge after completing a run, so there's a lot of value here if you're a perfectionist.  And the game's beautiful graphics, balletic animations and excellent level design always reward me for coming back to previous challenges.

Lastly, the ability to watch replays of the top players is also an excellent addition, both to help you see how others solved tricky spots and to help you improve your game.

This is a real gem, grab it if you like platformers with style!

EDIT: I've enjoyed my time with Dust Force, but unforunately I feel like I've hit the skill ceiling.  I've gotten to a point in the levels where I'm just not good enough to progress further, and don't think it's worth my entertainment time to put in the hours to get better.  This in NO WAY is the fault of the game or it's developers.  I still think Dust Force is amazing, but unfortunately I just won't be able to crack open its higher level content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964389765', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1583301496}
review: i wish i was a cleaner

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1414224689}
review:
The concept behind Dustforce is really pretty cool. It's basically Super Meat Boy with some sort of janitors as main characters. You defeat enemies by slamming them with your broom while running/jumping/gliding/sliding around the level (Meat Boy style !) sweeping the leaves that lay around. You get scored for speed and effectiveness and it's actually extremely difficult. Especially if you want to earn S ranks for every level.

The thing is... the controls just don't feel right. Controllers aren't automatically recognized and configured so you have to do that yourself. A controller definitely works better than a keyboard, I can tell you that, but if you don't know how to properly set it up it's still really hard to play.
I did finish Super Meat Boy, but I won't be able to finish this until they succesfully implement controller functionality without the player having to mess around with it.
Controller issues aside, this is a great game that just needs to be experienced.

[Rating: 78/100]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970905469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1415051511}

review:
This game I purchased for the music alone.

The gameplay is difficult but rewarding, and incredibly fluid. I've never played a platformer that felt this awesome. I highly recommend ditching the x360 wired for this and using the Sega Saturn USB controller, it feels perfect for this game.

There are a large selection of levels that will take most people a LONG time to unlock due to the way the difficulty curve ramps up.

Amazing, just needs some tweaks to multiplayer and it could be the Super Smash Bros. PC game we've all been waiting on.

review:
One of the most addictive little games I've played in a while. The graphics are slick and pretty, the music is moody and catchy.

The levels are well made and don't get cheap or rushed, unlike most plat formers. That said the later levels are nothing short of diabolical, and can take some patience. (Something you might need throughout)
I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a challenge or just something different from the larger titles released this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999552312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1470964383}
review:
My first instinct is to call Dustforce the relaxed cousin of Super Meat Boy, but that's not quite right.  Sure, it's got wall-jumping, air-dashing heroes, but the gameplay is more akin to racing around a track than trying to pass through a hostile environment.  The elegent controls let you achieve a zen that lets you almost float through a level without stopping, all while looking impressive with a top-notch simplistic art style and catchy music.
It's not a terribly difficult game, but pulling a double-S rank on a stage is still incredibly rewarding.  Comparing scores with friends and passing the controller is a lot of fun, but the actual multiplayer feels tacked on.  There's no co-op as promised, only a survival deathmatch and king-of-the-hill style play.  For this game, though, multiplayer really isn't necessary to make the title worth the purchase.
All in all, it's a hip platformer that's a lot of fun without risking a broken controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967985295', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2404, 'last_played': 1376780606}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043465750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1344409200}
review:
If you like 2D platformers with tight controls, amazing and unique aesthetics that are simple to learn yet hard to master with intuitive level design and incredibly easy to use scoreboard systems, Dustforce is your new thing.

You can check out the full player review and more here, at
www.youtube.com/TheAzCorner

author: {'steamid': '76561198022208607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1342854000}
review:
3...2...1... LET'S DUST!

I never thought that phrase would be something to look forward to. Dustforce is a fantastic skill based platformer with a perfect difficulty curve, tight controls & gorgeous visuals. The gameplay is fast paced yet at the same time somehow relaxing. Nothing ever feels unachieveable in this game but still maintains a great challenge. This is definitely the most unique indie title I've played this year and already one of my favorites.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994145172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2346, 'last_played': 1405686875}
review:
2014 Edit: Why read when you can watch someone more eloquant than I? 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CVMGUjREdg
------
N with Donkey Kong Country 2 music.
Indie platformer (THE PRESSES HAVE BEEN HALTED) about passing over specific spots and adminstering parental-style broom violence to enemies (who are sometimes tiny animals, you jerk.) No plot to follow. You have to 'SS' perfect each level to progress entirely, so you'll need more dedication than your megamans.

The thing I enjoyed the most, is due to the generally sharp mechancis, there can be room to do suave recoveries. Lower ranked ss replays on the (well-implemented) leaderboards have been more mind-boggling because of this. 

However, there's many places that require pixel perfect actions (or some tricks, which are admittedly fun to figure out,) and the level designer has a habit of placing a clusterfuck of awkward near the end of a level. Slip up, and you're forced to restart. I spent 5 hours on one.
But damn if that music doesn't keep you going.
-And then I got calluses from a vido game for the first time.

Basically, liked meat boy? Try this.

Les graphismes sont corrects et la musique est d'assez bonne qualit√©.La jouabilit√© est r√©ussit et le jeu se rapproche beaucoup d'un super meat boy.Un √©diteur de niveaux va arriver tr√®s prochainemenest aussi pr√©sent et il y a un mode multi en local seulement (s√ªrement un mode online dans les prochaines mises √† jours).
Le principal d√©faut de ce jeux est que deux tiers des niveaux sont bloqu√©s, et que pour les obtenirs il faudra finir un niveau en ayant le score maximum ce qui nous oblige √† faire un perfect √† chaque niveau.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968761282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1631107476}
review:
If you're reading this, and you don't already own Dustforce, you have wounded me deeply ...
Granted, Dustforce isn't for everyone.  It's a game of reflexive memorization and perfection of execution.  You can play it for the art and music, and it's easily worth the regular $10 asking price, but this is only the kindly exterior of a much deeper, nefarious, and almost divine core.  Dustforce creates and manages a flow like few others when in motion, and deciphering and executing that flow is your challenge.  It is a steep hill, but the reward is genuine.

And once you've bought the game, head on over to www.lifeformed.bandcamp.com and buy the soundtrack.  Did I mention this amazing piece of work was made by 3 Austrailians?  Seriously ...  Just buy it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986213994', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2383, 'last_played': 1439151659}
review: Probably the best 2d platformer I've ever played.  Stylish, fun, and shockingly deep.  The soundtrack is excellent too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007143476', 'num_games_owned': 803, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1464716075}
review: Yet another new Indie precision platformer is born.  Dustforce reminds me of the days of Shinobi 3, and a few other platformers with ninja-like moves.  It's got tight controls, and will keep you repeating levels to get a higher score worthy enough to be in the top of the leaderboards.  Higher scores also give you more keys to open new, harder levels.  The best things I like about this game is the ambient chill soundtrack - which I haven't heard in a game for a long time - and the ability to playback the videos of any player from the leaderboard.  This should help first-timers understand the game system and best lines when tackling the stages.  Highly recommended for above-average skilled platform gamers only.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985119561', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1328256000}

review: I'm not a huge fan of platformers, but I got this because of the artstyle and chiptunes music. Turned out it was also a really really good game. Beware though, to unlock further levels you must master the first ones, which can get rage-inducingly difficult pretty early. Still, I think this will be on my harddrive to be picked up now and then for quite some time. You should buy it too.

review: One of the best platformers to this day. I haven't had this much fun with this genre since old school Super Mario and Sonic&Knuckles. Beautiful aesthetics, addicting music, and a difficulty curve fit for all ranges. If you want to play Super Meat Boy meets Sonic meets Mario, try this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993300050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1514591514}
review: Platforming parkour with a martial cleaning twist. Momentum plays a big part in tackling each level. With a uniquely designed physics engine that focuses on speed, momentum and responsive controls at speed. Well designed difficulty curve and pleanty of challenge. The asthetic compliments the game perfectly with a unique cross between a retro game and a saturday morning 80's cartoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049098222', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1470202111}
review: If you haven't already gotten this game...Do so now. It's an amazing game. I mean, come on, you're playing Acrobatic Ninja Janitors! Jumping off walls, Running up them, Hanging from the ceilings, unleashing a flurry of strikes on enemies to clean them up with a broom, feather duster(s), or even a friggin' puff of air from a vaccuum! I mean...Come on, you TOTALLY don't see this kind of thing happen everyday. This game is totally worth the money. And at a low price too. You'd be a damn fool not to buy it while it's hot. And this game IS HOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014895533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1414889300}
review:
This game is pure fucking genius.
Seriously, who would have thought that a game about cleaning could be so damn good?
Super tight controls, gorgeous visuals, great soundtrack, challenging levels and loads of playtime for the pricetag.
Think Super Meat Boy meets 2D Mirror's Edge.
WARNING: THIS GAME IS HARD. If you are not the sort of person that doesn't like a difficult game, do not buy this. The game is all about perfection and improvement, and you will not enjoy it if you are not prepared to put in the patience. If you are, it's one of the best games to come out in a long, long time. I fear this may end up massively underappreciated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057430143', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 12690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6873, 'last_played': 1590333734}
review: Polished platformer that's light on GPU requirements which like all platformers is "easy to play but tough to master". Checkpointing is done nicely and the ability to see other players replays is a nice touch. The tutorial seems somewhat tough for a newbie but it does introduce all the core mechanics. The difficulty ramps up rather quickly and you'll either want to spend some time in the tutorial experimenting what you can/cannot do or watch replays of other players. SS is more difficult to get than you think! =D

author: {'steamid': '76561197967542349', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1386201950}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993637363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1396988965}
review: De tr√®s bonnes anims, mais attention, la prise en main de Dustforce s‚Äôav√®re tr√®s laborieuse, en raison m√™me du gameplay du jeu. On maintient quasi tout le temps une direction enfonc√©e qu'on fait varier plus ou moins rapidement. J'ai test√© plusieurs types de contr√¥les, mais la gestion hasardeuse du stick analogique XBOX360 et le jeu √† la croix directionnelle se r√©v√©lant trop fatiguant, j'ai finalement opt√© pour les contr√¥les clavier par d√©faut!!! Dustforce est beaucoup moins nerveux qu'un certain Super Meat Boy, comme l'illustre l'effroyable boucle sonore type "d√©mo de gameplay" √† laquelle vous aurez droit √† chaque niveau. Le but est de compl√©ter chaque tableau en effectuant le perfect run attendu. Autant dire que c'est assez r√©barbatif et que le jeu r√©siste beaucoup avant de livrer son plein potentiel. A r√©server aux hardcore gamers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978542803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1340866800}
review: Tight precision platformer.  Takes a while to learn the controls, compared to stuff like Super Meat Boy, but it's very satisfying and addicting.  Overall easier than SMB too, if that was a bit too hardcore for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964018315', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1327564800}
review: If Super Meat Boy was your game, and the new Sonic games aren't cutting it, GET DUSTFORCE! The silky smooth animation and rhythm generated by this game makes replaying every level for that perfect time so easy and fun. The atmosphere and visual look of this game makes it easy to watch all the replays from the leaderboards quite enjoyable too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991652633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4653, 'last_played': 1447826452}
review: Great music (which comes in .ogg format in the game folders!), gorgeous art, tight controls, and some very well-made levels to go along with those controls. The game can be difficult, especially when you start unlocking the Silver and Gold stages, but if you could handle Super Meat Boy's bullshit, you can handle this without a problem. If you want a good, hard platformer, then this game is a good choice to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993106279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1809, 'last_played': 1595913551}
review: Awesome platformer.  For comparison: I'd say it's easier to get through a level of Dustforce than a level of Super Meat Boy.  But getting 100% on a level on Dustforce makes Super Meat Boy A+ look like a child's gold star.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969947976', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2118, 'last_played': 1429662481}
review: This game is soo chill. It can be hard at times to perfect levels(to get keys to unlock more levels) but the music will calm you down oh soo fresh. Great Game all around!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994025544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42565, 'last_played': 1519479609}
review:
I enjoy video games. I like the thrill of shooting monsters and solving sliding puzzles, I relish exploring the world and having adventures in it, I love seeing my cities and theme parks grow because I made them just so. Crawling through dungeons, directing your minions strategically to best your foe, sneaking around conspiracy theory-laden faculties ‚Äì video games are a rich medium with terrific entries in all kinds of experience. And even though I don‚Äôt particularly enjoy role-playing games, I can see why it‚Äôs pleasing to build and personalize a character of your making and vanquish your enemies. Even in a world with such a varied library of enterprises, there‚Äôs a single holy grail for me: finesse.

Let‚Äôs use my favorite game of 2012, Dustforce, to illustrate. Dustforce is a platformer made Hitbox Team, a group of four people. It stars four janitors (the eponymous ‚ÄúDustforce‚Äù) who are put up against stages filled with leaves, rubbish, slime, and other waste that they can aptly clean up by swinging their broom (which involves walking over it). They‚Äôre not your average grumpy, unshaven, high school brutes though ‚Äì they‚Äôre agile acrobats who can climb walls, hang on ceilings and traverse the most dangerous of environments. However, it‚Äôs not the dangerous environments that are the main objective of the game (though they will certainly test you, especially later), it‚Äôs finishing the stages completely clean ‚Äì and herein lies the game‚Äôs greatest strength. The game measures two things, and rates you, at the end of the stage, accordingly: completion and finesse. Completion is the percentage of dust you cleaned up and enemies you defeated. Finesse is how often you lost your combo, preferably never ‚Äì it‚Äôs a meter at the bottom of the screen that tracks how long it has been since you last dutifully scraped the last specks off the floor, and you lose it after a given amount of time. These two combined make for a drive to hone your abilities and learn every stage so that you sweep through it both smoothly and flawlessly.

The levels themselves are created in such a way that doing it right will give you a great flow through it, never really slowing down or losing a beat, making for a great sense of satisfaction when you finish them thoroughly. Not only that, but the stages gently go from very easy but enjoyable to an excruciating but very gratifying hard. If you happen to run into the later stages when you‚Äôre still a rookie cleaner, they will seem daunting to you, almost impossible. When you come back later, however, you suddenly realize how it‚Äôs done, and after a few runs, you will be able to beat that which looked to be so insurmountable to you earlier. It‚Äôs this ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe I did that‚Äù feeling, this ascendancy, that is so bliss. And it‚Äôs never because you upgraded your fanciful armor at a merchant, or upgraded your cannon with gems, it‚Äôs just you. You, physically, became more dexterous and skilled at this game. Your character didn‚Äôt gain any new abilities, he didn‚Äôt become stronger, you did. The realization of this is an amazing feeling, because it‚Äôs so fair ‚Äì you put time into this, and you reaped the benefits by knocking out the obstacles in ways you earlier never thought possible.

Reinforcing this sentiment in Dustforce is the sleek graphic style, emphasizing the player‚Äôs action through a simple, but well animated, cel shaded style which make the janitors a joy to look at while they bounce through the environment. These environments, too, look great ‚Äì while clearly being what they are (a city, a mountainous forest, a laboratory, and a crumbling mansion) they are presented in stylish, sometimes almost surreal ways, making for an aestethically pleasing journey through them. Also accompanying these is a terrific soundtrack, which never gets monotonous or annoying, even if you spend hours perfecting those later levels. It‚Äôs these elements that make mastering Dustforce a real joy, and here‚Äôs hoping many more follow its ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993113016', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1435133749}
review: It's like N combined with Mirror's Edge combined with Mario Sunshine. You run, jump, and clean.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983841339', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1384049046}
review:
It's January and Dustforce has quickly become my favorite indie game game of 2012. The game oozes with style and just about everything you would want for a 2-D platformer. Think Super Meatboy with the same challenging levels and tight controls, but a more zen-enducing aroma and style. You will die a ton trying to get SS ranks on a few levels, but unlike Meat Boy you won't curse every time. 

The game also reminds me a lot of Donkey Kong Jungle Beat (the underrated 2-D game for GCN using the Bongos) in a really good way: The goal is to keep a combo through the entire level by moving along every single line of dust or beating down an enemy. If those two objectives are left undone for more than 5 seconds or you are hurt, you lose the combo. 

Overall you get this sweet sweet sense of flow while you're playing and it's all too addicting. You WANT to get perfect at this game. Thanks to the ability to watch replays from top-scorers, its possible, too. 

BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006581408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1327132800}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006942301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1340262000}
review:
What happens when someone wants to make a game about janitors with the control scheme of Megaman Zero and a pinch of Sonic the Hedgehog's speed? We get Dustforce.

Each of the game's "worlds" contain plenty of pre-unlocked levels to master as you meander your way through them one after another to unlock the rest of the more challenging and meaty ones. As boring as collecting dust sounds, the mechanic of picking it up without letting your combo meter drop makes every level challenging and fun. The addition of a high-score board for each level adds tons of replayability even after you've mastered a level.

Dustforce is an excellent and subtely-challenging game that I definitely recommend picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021657366', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1446856833}
review:
First Precision Platformer of the year, and boy is it a doozy!

I've never been so frustrated, yet delighted at the same time!

Not to mention the wicked awesome soundtrack.

And to think, it's not even done yet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005763217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 9012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4897, 'last_played': 1653746533}
review:
I played and loved super meat boy. It was the hallmark of hardcore platformer when it was released but Dustforce is vastly superior in many ways. 

The gameplay is technical and deep. It takes a while to fully appreciate it and master it but when you have done it you realise that there is a flow in this game and a genius in the level design. I can go through a level just for the pleasure of following that flow and the music goes with it perfectly.

It is a challenging game, very challenging in the end. If you can‚Äôt handle frustration it might not be for you but it is also rewarding if you can go through it.

I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. It isn‚Äôt just the best hardcore platformer of all time it is also one of my favourite game period.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970505271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1385836272}

review: If you enjoy games like Super Meat Boy in any way whatsoever then for the love of god buy Dustforce. It is extremely challenging, with intricate controls requiring a lot of precision but the satisfaction from nailing a level is amazing and just moving smoothly through levels feels awesome. Graphics and sound are also excellent for a small indie game. Buy it! Buy it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1450641965}
review:
Si tengo que comparar un juego con este, seria el Super Meat Boy.
La principal diferencia es que en SMB el unico objetivo era pasarse el nivel con el menor tiempo posible, aqui hay que hacer el nivel perfecto, es decir, hacer el trazado limpio y limpiando todas las hojas de por medio. Al completar el nivel de esa forma dan una llave de plata para abrir otros niveles mas dificiles,y al pasarse un nivel de llave plata, dan una llave de oro para niveles aun mas dificiles...
Otra diferencia es que en SMB a veces se podia hacer algun trazado un poco... "cheto", mientras que aqui el trazado esta bastante marcado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003263424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1345532400}

Precision platformer at its best.

And it's designed for digital (keyboard) instead of analogic (gamepad) controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018595759', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1518742282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003844735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1327046400}
review: Dustforce is a fascinating platformer that calls to mind everything there was to love about Super Meat Boy, with a dash of extra replayability mixed in. The balls-hard platforming exists just as SMB, however, the dust mechanic adds replayability and online competition. The overworld level strikes me as a bit tedious; I would have preferred a traditional world map for easy replaying of frustrating levels.  The charming artwork and catchy, mellow chiptune soundtrack makes for an awesome experience. A fantastic first release from Hitbox Team. Once they get the level editor out, I'm excited to see what they cook up next.  As for Dustforce, the best part of messes is no longer making them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988296427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1690810616}
review:
Superb game!

This game FEELS amazing. With gorgeously stylized visuals and amazingly fluid controls, this was one of the best experiences I've had with 2D platformers.

It's very heavy on the competitive aspect focusing on speed running. You get to try the same levels over and over again until you are happy with your performance, then you proceed to submit your score and realize you are in a 4 digits place on the leader board. You then check the first place's replay to see how he\she did it and your jaw drops on the floor refusing to believe that's humanly possible.

It's a very nice game about a very interesting and unusual theme. The animation quality is top notch and the controls are very responsive.

I recommend this game regardless if you are into high score based speed running games or not. It has too many good things about it for you to miss out on it.

It also kind of gives you a very unusual urge to clean up your room in a very speedy manner, so that's deffinitely a plus! :D

review: This game is amazingly awesome. The music, the gameplay, the graphics. This indie game is just so wonderfully executed. I'm a huge fan of Super Meatboy but this game is on a whole other world. If you haven't bought it yet, WHY HAVEN'T YOU? Ever since I saw the videos and previews I knew this game was a Day One buy for me. And I have not regretted it. Beyond epic game with great gameplay, graphics and music...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993241467', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1327046400}
review:
The animation is top notch; the fluidity of movement is simple to understand but difficult to master; the act of cleaning creatures and having little companions follow you about is endearing; the music is cheery and fabulous; and the overall level design is a fine balance of exploration and speed.

It's like playing Sonic with a bit of Strider.
